AnchorError.why: Program constraint violation, account validation failed, or instruction error
fix: Check the specific AnchorError variant in the error message
Verify account constraints match the program expectations
Ensure all required accounts are provided
Check account data matches expected format
Verify account ownership is correct
Check account mutability constraints
Review Anchor program constraints

TransactionError.why: Transaction was rejected by the network or program
fix: Check transaction logs for specific error code
Verify sufficient SOL for transaction fees
Ensure all accounts are writable if needed
Check program instruction data is correct
Verify transaction size is within limits
Check for duplicate transactions
Verify recent blockhash is valid

AccountValidationError.why: Account doesn't have required keys, signatures, or permissions
fix: Verify account is signer if required
Check account has correct owner program
Ensure account is writable if modifying data
Verify account has sufficient balance
Check account data length matches expected
Verify account is initialized
Check account discriminator is correct

InstructionError.why: Instruction data invalid, program logic error, or constraint violation
fix: Check instruction index in error message
Verify instruction data format matches program expectations
Review program logs for specific constraint failure
Ensure all instruction accounts are correct
Check instruction data serialization
Verify instruction program ID is correct
Check for instruction size limits

NetworkError.what: Failed to connect to Solana network
NetworkError.why: RPC endpoint unreachable, network issue, or invalid cluster
fix: Check RPC endpoint URL is correct
Verify network connectivity
Try a different RPC endpoint
Check if using correct cluster (mainnet, devnet, testnet)
Verify RPC endpoint is operational
Check for rate limiting on RPC
Use local validator for testing

ProgramError.why: Program returned error code or panicked
fix: Check program error code in logs
Review program source code for error conditions
Verify program logic handles all cases
Check for integer overflow/underflow
Verify account data is valid
Check program instruction handler
Review program constraints and validations

InsufficientFunds.why: Account doesn't have enough SOL for fees or rent
fix: Add SOL to the account: solana airdrop
Check account balance before transaction
Reduce transaction size to lower fees
Verify rent-exempt minimum balance
Check for fee payer account balance
Use smaller transaction if possible

AccountNotFound.why: Account address is invalid or account doesn't exist
fix: Verify account address (public key) is correct
Check if account needs to be created first
Verify account exists on the cluster
Check for typos in account address
Ensure account is initialized
Verify account hasn't been closed

InvalidOwner.why: Account is owned by wrong program or not owned by expected program
fix: Verify account owner program ID is correct
Check if account needs to be initialized
Verify program can modify the account
Check account was created by correct program
Verify PDA derivation is correct
Check for account ownership transfer issues

PDAError.why: PDA derivation failed or PDA account issue
fix: Verify PDA seeds are correct
Check PDA derivation function
Ensure program ID matches
Verify PDA account exists or create it
Check PDA bump seed is correct
Verify PDA address calculation

RentError.why: Account doesn't meet rent exemption requirements
fix: Add more SOL to account for rent
Check account data size vs rent requirements
Verify account is rent-exempt
Calculate required rent: getMinimumBalanceForRentExemption
Close account if no longer needed
Reduce account data size if possible

SerializationError.what: Account or instruction data serialization error
SerializationError.why: Data format doesn't match expected structure
fix: Check data serialization format matches program
Verify Anchor account struct matches
Check Borsh serialization is correct
Verify data length matches expected
Check for endianness issues
Review account data layout

ComputeBudgetError.why: Program used more compute units than allowed
fix: Optimize program to use less compute
Set higher compute budget if appropriate
Break transaction into smaller operations
Reduce program instruction complexity
Check for infinite loops in program
Use compute budget instructions
